thread.title: Local Roundup: Tigers beat another ranked team
thread.title_full: Local Roundup: Tigers beat another ranked team

author: The Record
title: Local Roundup: Tigers beat another ranked team
text: Posted Oct. 4, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated at 10:37 PM Posted Oct. 4, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated at 10:37 PM » Social News University of the Pacific’s men’s water polo team opened the Mountain Pacific Sports Federation season with a victory over another top-10 team. The fifth-ranked Tigers beat No. 7 UC Santa Barbara 9-6 Sunday in Santa Barbara with the help of four goals by Ben Stevenson. Stevenson’s four goals tied a season high. It was his ninth multigoal match this season and his seventh game with at least three goals. He is Pacific’s overall leader with 30 goals. Aleksandar Petrovic added two goals for the Tigers (11-1, 1-0) and Brady Moore had 15 saves. The Gauchos are 9-4, 0-2. FIELD HOCKEY Pacific 3, Michigan State 2 At East Lansing, Michigan, the Tigers fell behind 2-0 but scored two times in a three-minute span and got the game winner from Ali Campos at the 69:59 mark. Kelsey Gulledge and Rylee Comeau scored scored for the Tigers (7-5). The Spartans are 4-8. MEN’S SOCCER Bakersfield 2, Pacific 0 At Bakersfield, the Tigers fell to 1-9-1-0 despite outshooting Bakersfield 13-5. Daniel Dreier and Simon Doherty scored for Bakersfield (3-3-2). WOMEN’S SOCCER Loyola Marymount 2, Pacific 0 Goalkeeper Lena Perry had six saves for the Tigers (1-8-1, 0-2-0 West Coast Conference). Loyola Marymount improves to 8-3-1, 2-0-0. By The Record
